lead_paragraph: Amélie Mauresmo withdrew from the Pilot Pen and Rogers Cup tournaments yesterday, citing a need to fully recover from her appendectomy in March. “I rushed back too quickly because there was a lot at stake for me, especially on grass,” said Mauresmo, ranked No. 6. “Unfortunately, my body did not cooperate.”Francesca Schiavone, ranked 26th, will replace Mauresmo at the Pilot Pen event, which runs from Aug. 17-25 at Yale. The Rogers Cup is next week in Toronto.
